question_1.question: What is the purpose of using ADO.Net versions of CData according to the text?

options.option_a: To access a limited range of data sources
options.option_c: To access a wide array of different data sources
options.option_d: To reduce the number of available data sources

question_1.explanation: ADO.Net versions of CData provide the ability to access a wide array of different data sources, as mentioned in the text.

question_2.question: What should you do before attempting to go through the specific CData setup guides?

options.option_c: Map the data source to an ODX instance

question_2.explanation: The text specifies that one must go through the Initial setup before attempting to go through the specific CData setup guides.

question_3.question: When adding a CData data source and multiple versions are available, which version is generally recommended to choose?

options.option_a: The one with the lowest number
options.option_b: The one with the highest number
options.option_c: Any version as they are all the same
options.option_d: The version that is not available as a normal adapter

question_3.explanation: The text advises to generally choose the version with the highest number when multiple versions are available.

question_4.question: What happens after a synchronization in terms of default string size?

options.option_d: It is set to a user-defined value

question_4.explanation: After a synchronization, the default string size increases from 2000 to 4000, as stated in the text.

question_5.question: What is the general recommended verbosity level for setting up a log file for troubleshooting?
question_5.explanation: The text recommends using a verbosity level of 3 for setting up a log file for troubleshooting.

question_6.question: Which of the following is not listed as a specific CData provider setup in the provided context?
question_6.explanation: Connect to SQL Server is not listed in the provided context under the specific CData provider setup.
